Posts.Content: Elizabeth963 wrote: Well...after my stereostatic biopsy, the first radiologist said:  Atypical ductal hyperplasia and radial scar.  When the nurse called she said you'll have to have an excisional, so I prepared myself.  Then she said, "but first we will get your slides from the outside lab and have one of our specialist radiologists read it here just to make sure."  That sounded quite reasonable and good to me.  So I left it at that for a week, fully preparing myself for more surgery.  Yesterday the nurse called again, this time saying, "on second read there is no atypia, no hyperplasia..just a small radial scar..you don't need anything further."  I sat stunned in my car.  She also assured me that their radiologists are the ones to trust because they specialize in this stuff.  She herself is a breast cancer survivor and has total trust in these people, so I guess I do too.  The first rad was just a basic rad.  I guess this can happen...I never expected it.  So I sit here still stunned but happy.  I get to finally say, B9!!!!  I'm hoping all those waiting have a similar experience (well, skip the first reading altogether). This experience has given me a WHOLE NEW perspective on what women go thru... my understanding and compassion are much broader now.  It's life changing.  I hope to never go thru this again but if I do, I know right where to come for support.  Thank you all so much. XO, Elizabeth  Log in to post a reply
